did.unittitle: Federation of Telephone Workers of Pennsylvania Records

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: Federation of Telephone Workers of Pennsylvania

did.abstract: The Federation of Telephone Workers of Pennsylvania represented employees of telephone companies throughout Pennsylvania. This collection contains correspondence and reports regarding the activities of the Federation of Telephone Workers of Pennsylvania.

odd.head: Previous Citation
odd.p: Federation of Telephone Workers of Pennsylvania Records, 1945-1984, AIS.1984.28, Archives Service Center, University of Pittsburgh

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Federation of Telephone Workers of Pennsylvania Records, 1945-1984, AIS.1984.28, Archives & Special Collections, University of Pittsburgh

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Gift of Communication Workers of America, Local 13000 in 1984.

bioghist.head: History
bioghist.p: The Federation of Telephone Workers of Pennsylvania (FTWP) represented employees of telephone companies throughout Pennsylvania. In 1984, the FTWP merged with the Communication Workers of America to form CWA Local 13000. Frank Wentzel was president of the Pittsburgh Division of the FTWP and was responsible for leading the union into the CWA, where he served as an assistant to two CWA vice presidents.

userestrict.head: Copyright
userestrict.p: The University of Pittsburgh holds the property rights to the material in this collection, but the copyright may still be held by the original creator/author. Researchers are therefore advised to follow the regulations set forth in the U.S. Copyright Code when publishing, quoting, or reproducing material from this collection without the consent of the creator/author or that go beyond what is allowed by fair use.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: An inventory for this collection was written by Zachary Brodt in 2010.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This collection contains correspondence and reports regarding the activities of the Federation of Telephone Workers of Pennsylvania. Included is information on affiliation debates, committee meetings, and telephone technologies. The files document local, district and statewide issues and events, such as working conditions, elections and company reorganization.
